txt.en: Given time to reflect on her adventure with the Hidden Guard, Issuriel has come to a decision concerning her future.

'Thank you for coming to see me, [placeholder]. I have spent many days in restful peace here in Cerin Amroth, and it has done me a great deal of good; the effects of the Gwigael poison are now just a memory, and the spells of weakness have passed.'

Issuriel pauses for a moment, and seems unable to meet your gaze.

'I do not regret my decision to do without the Laidhris antidote, [placeholder]. Events unfolded differently than we thought they would, but I could not let the mission end in failure because of my own selfishness. Raddir did not have the choice I did, nor did Sigileth. Only Achardor seems to have understood what I came to know: that I would have closed my eyes forever if it meant the death and loss that happened to that point would have had a reason; that it would have mattered.

'Still, I am grateful for the actions of Bróin. I have picked a beautiful flower from the slopes of Cerin Amroth. Will you bring it to him in Moria, with my good wishes and my thankfulness? I understand he is recovering in the Peaceful Path, along Durin's Way.'
Bróin is in the Peaceful Path, located off Durin's Way, in Moria.\n\nIssuriel has given you a beautiful flower to give to Bróin as a token of her friendship and thankfulness.

'I owe my life to Bróin. I did not think to count a dwarf among my closest friends, but now I cannot help but do so.\n\n'Present company excepted, of course! You are a dwarf quite close to my heart as well, [placeholder]! Do not take offence at my clumsy words.'
'I owe my life to Bróin. I did not think to count a dwarf among my closest friends, but now I cannot help but do so.'

You give Bróin the flower and tell him of Issuriel's words.

'Well, uh, I don't know what to say! I... well... it is an honour, of course, and....'

Bróin turns a bright shade of pink and manages to stammer out an apology before starting again.

'It was nothing, of course, just the decent thing to do, and she such a noble Elf and all, and being so courageous on my people's account. It would be a dwarf of little honour who would abandon Issuriel to that vile poison. A Dourhand might, but no son of Brogur nor of Bósi, for that matter!

'She has the heart of a dwarf, I will tell you that! I mean... by that I mean that she is as brave as a dwarf, you understand, and not that she has my own heart, though of course she does, for how could she not? But what I mean is....'

Exhausted from the effort, Bróin lapses into confused silence and stares at you, red-faced.

'I should stick with the Orc-slaying, [placeholder]. I find it to be much easier!'
'It was nothing, [placeholder]. Anyone would have done what I did for Issuriel!'
'I should comb my beard before I next see Issuriel. It is all tangled!'
Bring Issuriel's elanor blossom to Bróin in the Peaceful Path
'Bróin is very brave, is he not?'
